chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew M. Haubrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew M. Haubrich is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew M. Haubrich was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Matthew M. Haubrich was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Matthew M. Haubrich was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Eau Claire County case 16CF885

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Pay fine of $1355.00 on Ct 4 and $300 on Ct 5 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  To be paid while on probation on Count 1.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Co deft, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Conditions same as Eau Claire County Circuit Court.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. No appearance by the Defendant. Clerk/H. Barnett. Deft has been kicked out of the drug treatment court in Eau Claire and has absconded and there is an apprehension warrant in place. No action taken.
Order Terminating Judicial Assignment (of Eau Claire Co. Judge Michael Schumacher due to termination of specialty court assignment)
Hearing on August 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Granting Motion to Terminate (Absconding/Probation Revocation/Incarceration in Another Jurisdiction) and Administrative Transfer Out of Treatment Court.  The Court finds that the DE's activities & whereabouts are unknown to the Treatment Court coordinator, case manager, and probation agent for two or more consecutive weeks.  It is ordered that participation in Treatment Court is terminated.  The case shall be administratively transferred to the court of origin, Kenosha Co. Circuit Court Branch 6, for further proceedings.  (Order dated 7/31/17 and signed by Judge Michael Schumacher of Eau Claire Co.)

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2, 3 & 6 are dismissed; the KPD Citation V9981145 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty to ct 4.  Court finds deft guilty of ct 4.  On ct 1 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions concurrent to Eau Claire County case 16CF885; 6 months conditional jail w/credit for 3 days served; Huber privileges allowed as per Eau Claire drug court rules; costs ordered, deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; on ct 4 the court imposes sentence of 90 days jail w/credit for 3 days served concurrent to ct 1 and concurrent to Eau Claire County case 16CF885; Huber privileges allowed as per Eau Claire drug court rules; $1,355.00 total fine/costs (including IID surcharge), bond applied, remainder to be paid during period of probation on ct 1; 16 month revocation of DL; IID; OWI assessment; on ct 5 the court imposes sentence of 90 days jail w/credit for 3 days served concurrent to cts 1 & 4 and to Eau Claire County case 16CF885; Huber allowed allowed as per Eau Claire drug court rules; deft to pay $300 fine plus costs, to be paid during period of probation on ct1.
With Karolyn/ADA Phan and Atty Komp the SEH of 12/7/16 at 2:30pm is rescheduled, as the State needs to prepare a writ for deft; reset to  12/9/17 at 10am.

Per Sgt Zoerner the writ for the deft can not be executed.  He is not at the Eau Claire County Jail and has never been there.  He is on Community Supervision out of Eau Claire, with no phone number listed.

With Atty Komp and by agreement of ADA Phan and Judge Wagner the SEH of 10/24/16 at 9:30am is rescheduled; to know for sure whether he's been revoked or admitted into Drug Court in Eau Claire; reset to 12/7/16 at 2:30pm.
Copy of e-mails from Atty Komp and ADA Phan.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case set for sentencing today on Counts 1 and 5 and a plea & sentencing on Count 4.  Def. requests hearing be adjourned until sentencing after revocation in another file.   Resceduled for 10/24/16 at 9:30.  Counts 2, 3, and 6 to be addressed at that time.  Bond continued.

With ADA Phan and Atty Komp, and by approval of Judge Wagner, the SEH of 8/4/16 at 11am is rescheduled, as the State just became aware that the deft is in custody in Eau Claire on charges there; reset to 8/24/16 at 1:30pm.

Atty Komp requested to adjourn the SEH of 7/14/16 at 8:45am as the deft's ride is his mother and she is caring for the deft's brother, ADA Phan objects to adjournment; Court allows adjournment due to a conflict w/the court's calendar, deft to produce proof of brothers illness; reset to 8/4/16 at 11am.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards requests adjournment to date with Atty Komp is back, also states deft did have contacts w/Agent by e-mail contrary to what is stated in the PSI.  SEH 7/14/16 at 8:45am; agent to be notified that the deft is now willing to participate with the PSI, revised PSI to be filed, current PSI does not include information of his recent arrest or violations.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 5.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 5.  PSI ordered.  SEH 5/13/16 at 8:45am.  Deft to enter plea on ct 4 at time of sentencing; balance of cts will be also addressed at time of sentencing.  Bond continued.
With Atty Komp the PLEAS of 1/28/16 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as she is working on getting verification that the deft is in treatment; reset to 3/10/16 at 8:30am.

with Atty Komp and by agreement of ADA Phan the PLEAS of 11/24/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled; as the deft relies on his mother for transportation and she is unable to get off work; reset to 1/28/16 at 1:15pm.
With Atty Komp the PLEAS of 9/21/15 at 8:15am is rescheduled, as deft is still in treatment; reset to 11/24/15 at 8:30am.
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  PLEAS set over to 9/21/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

With Atty Komp the PLEAS of 6/8/15 at 3:30pm is rescheduled, as the deft wants to serve his sentence in Eau Claire and would like the sentencing to take place on a Friday so that he does not miss work, Huber is being set up; reset to 7/24/15 at 9am.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo states the deft resides in Eau Claire, will be attempting to set it up so he can serve his sentence there.  PLEAS set for 6/8/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Komp and ADA Phan the FPT of 2/25/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as the deft resides in Eau Claire and is going to start an AODA program; reset to 4/30/15 at 1:30pm.

With Atty Komp and ADA Phan the FPT of 12/4/14 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as the deft has a case in Eau Claire and was sentenced to 10 days jail for which he will report on 12/29, he plans to do Ch. 85 treatment once he's out; reset to 2/25/15 at 8:30am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

With Atty Komp the FPT of 10/20/14 at 8:45am is rescheduled; as the deft has two DPA's in Eau Claire where he is being revoked and will probably get 20 days jail; his court date in Eau Claire is 10/22; FPT reset to 12/4/14 at 8:30am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Komp acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 10/17/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 10/20/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
